metadata.Description: Energy derived from biomass, such as organic materials or agricultural residues, through processes like combustion or fermentation.

level 1.Description: Bioenergy implements the Energy Efficiency Policy by promoting the use of renewable energy sources.
Bioenergy funds research and development projects to improve the efficiency and sustainability of bioenergy production.
Bioenergy focuses on sustainable biomass production to ensure the availability of renewable feedstock for bioenergy generation.
Bioenergy plays a role in the renewable energy portfolio by contributing to the overall share of renewable energy sources.
Bioenergy partners with local communities to promote the sustainable production and use of bioenergy, creating economic opportunities and reducing reliance on fossil fuels.
Bioenergy contributes to climate change mitigation by reducing greenhouse gas emissions through the substitution of fossil fuels with renewable bioenergy.
Bioenergy monitors the production of bioenergy to ensure compliance with sustainability criteria and environmental standards.
Bioenergy targets rural electrification by providing decentralized energy solutions through the use of bioenergy technologies.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

level 2.Subject: energy efficiency
level 2.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 2.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

level 2.Subject: renewable energy certificates
level 2.Description: Renewable energy certificates contribute to climate change mitigation efforts by promoting the use of clean and sustainable energy sources.

level 3.Subject: energy storage
level 3.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

level 3.Subject: energy markets
level 3.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.
